meanings.definition: Pleasure tinged with sadness or pain.
meanings.sent1: The movie's ending was a bittersweet moment for the audience.
meanings.sent2: Eating the last slice of cake was a bittersweet experience.
meanings.sent3: It was bittersweet to say goodbye to her friends as she moved to a new city.
meanings.sent4: The bittersweet memories of childhood lingered in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The bittersweet melody of the song brought tears to her eyes.

meanings.definition: A taste that is both bitter and sweet.
meanings.sent1: The chocolate had a bittersweet flavor that lingered on the palate.
meanings.sent2: The bittersweet taste of the dark chocolate was surprisingly delightful.
meanings.sent3: She savored the bittersweet flavor of the coffee as she watched the sunrise.
meanings.sent4: The bittersweet aftertaste of the dessert left her craving for more.
meanings.sent5: The bittersweet tang of the lemonade was a refreshing surprise.

meanings.definition: A plant with small, brightly colored flowers.
meanings.sent1: The bittersweet plant added a pop of color to the garden.
meanings.sent2: She admired the delicate beauty of the bittersweet flowers in the vase.
meanings.sent3: The bittersweet blooms brightened up the room with their vibrant hues.
meanings.sent4: The bittersweet plant in the backyard attracted butterflies with its colorful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The bittersweet blossoms swayed gently in the breeze, creating a picturesque scene.
